query: where should I put the dish into? oven How do I prepare the potatoes for roasting?
text: 1. Adjust oven rack to upper middle position and preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large baking dish, combine potatoes, rosemary, and 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil. Set baking dish aside to cool; keep oven on.

text: 1. Adjust oven rack to upper middle position and preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large baking dish, combine potatoes, rosemary, and 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil. Set baking dish aside to cool; keep oven on.

query: what temperature should I preheat the oven to? to 400°f How should I prepare the squash for this step?
text: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

query: What should I do with the mushrooms after they have soaked?
text: 1. In a small heatproof bowl or measuring cup, soak mushrooms in boiling water until fully softened, about 20 minutes. query: what am I preheating the oven to? to 400°f How should I prepare the squash for this step?
text: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

In this recipe, how can I flavor the squash? toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt. Toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt. how many tablespoons of olive oil again? 2 tablespoons (30ml) should I cut the sage? sage What am I supposed to do while the different trays are baking? Stirring once or twice during baking how long should I cook it for? about 45 minutes how long am I cooking the small chunks for? about 30 minutes Done. What's next? Discard sage sprigs from large squash chunks. do I need to take the sage out of the large chunks of squash tray? yes what am I doing with the mixture next? food processor, blender okay Alexa what am I putting in the food processor? large squash chunks, apple, and garlic cloves How should I proceed after placing the squash, apple, and garlic into the food processor? Add miso and 1/4 cup (60ml) broth and blend until a smooth purée forms. What do I do once I have the puree ready? Season with salt. what should I season it with? salt what should I do with the olive oil? heat i've put the olive oil in a pressure cooker what what heat do I need to have it on? medium-high heat What should I do next with the onions after heating the olive oil? Add onion and cook, stirring, until translucent but not browned, about 4 minutes. what am I adding to the pressure cooker do I need to add something? onion so I have put the rice in what do I want to be coated in oil? rice okay Alexa how long am I cooking the Rice for? 4 minutes right what am I putting in next? rice How can I tell if the rice is toasted properly? Rice grains should start to look like tiny ice cubes: translucent around the edges and cloudy in the center. what smell am I looking for? raw alcohol what do I add next? wine how long do I cook it for? about 2 minutes How will I know when to stop cooking the wine? <extra_id_0> 6. Add wine and cook, stirring, until raw alcohol smell has cooked off and wine has almost fully evaporated, about 2 minutes.

answer: cook, stirring, until raw alcohol smell has cooked off and wine has almost fully evaporated, about 2 minutes.

query: what am I preheating the oven to? to 400°f How should I prepare the squash for this step? Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In this recipe, how can I flavor the squash?
text: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

text: 8. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, melt butter over medium-high heat until foaming subsides, 2 to 3 minutes. Add remaining 8 sage leaves and fry, gently swirling, until milk solids in butter turn a hazelnut-brown color, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat. query: How do I handle the mushroom after soaking it?
text: 1. In a small heatproof bowl or measuring cup, soak mushrooms in boiling water until fully softened, about 20 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove mushrooms from soaking liquid and squeeze out excess moisture back into the bowl or measuring cup. Reserve rehydrated mushrooms and 1/4 cup (60ml) soaking liquid, making sure to dispose of any grit that has settled at the bottom.

query: How should I prepare the quail for cooking?
text: 1. Season quail all over with salt. In a large cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add quail. If quail are spatchcocked, cook them skin side down until well browned, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook other side until desired doneness is reached (quail can be served from medium-rare to well done, as desired; they are too small to accurately use a thermometer, so feel free to cut into the meat to check doneness). If using deboned quail, cook on both sides, turning frequently, until browned on both sides and desired doneness is reach, about 4 minutes per side for medium.
input: Question Answering: How should I prepare the quail for cooking? <extra_id_0> 1. Season quail all over with salt. In a large cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add quail. If quail are spatchcocked, cook them skin side down until well browned, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook other side until desired doneness is reached (quail can be served from medium-rare to well done, as desired; they are too small to accurately use a thermometer, so feel free to cut into the meat to check doneness). If using deboned quail, cook on both sides, turning frequently, until browned on both sides and desired doneness is reach, about 4 minutes per side for medium.
gold_answer: Season quail all over with salt.
target_answer: true Season quail all over with salt.
answer: Season quail all over with salt.

If quail are spatchcocked, cook them skin side down until well browned, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook other side until desired doneness is reached (quail can be served from medium-rare to well done, as desired; they are too small to accurately use a thermometer, so feel free to cut into the meat to check doneness). If using deboned quail, cook on both sides, turning frequently, until browned on both sides and desired doneness is reach, about 4 minutes per side for medium.

Let stand until peppers are fully softened, 30 minutes to 1 hour. how long should I let the peppers soften? 30 minutes should I leave it for an hour? 30 minutes to 1 hour What do I need to do if the peppers aren't softening? If the peppers are very stubborn (as thick-skinned ñoras can be), you may need to tear a small hole in them to let water penetrate inside. What do I discard from the skin? the flesh What do I do with the pepper skins after scraping off the flesh? Discard skins. what should I heat in the saucepan? oil how hot should the saucepan be? medium-high heat how long should I do this for? about 6 minutes what do I continue to stir for this amount of time? sofrito what do I do after these 30 minutes? stir in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes longer how long should I keep this in the refrigerator for? 5 days what if I don't have a 10-inch paella pan? 10-inch paella pan what do I use this pan for? heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering What's the method to heat the oil for the paella? heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. how long do I cook this chicken for? about 8 minutes How should chicken be cooked for it to be deeply browned on both sides? cook, turning, until deeply browned on both sides, about 8 minutes. Can you tell me more about how to make the ingredients sizzle? cook, stirring and scraping until well mixed and sizzling What should be done after adding the sofrito, paprika, and saffron? cook, stirring and scraping until well mixed and sizzling Ok. what's next? Sprinkle in rice all over, making sure all grains are submerged and none are stuck on top of the pieces of chicken. what do I do with this spatula? gently swirl the liquid around to distribute the rice evenly what should I reduce the heat to? reduce heat to medium-low what am I cooking for 8 minutes? rice and chicken mixture What should I be doing while the food is cooking for 8 minutes? Cook for 8 minutes without stirring, then season shrimp with salt and nestle around the chicken thighs. what temperature should it be at? low What can I do if I start noticing some scorching at the bottom? Reduce heat to low at any point to prevent scorching on bottom. What should I do if the mix in the pan is getting too dry while cooking? If the liquid cooks off and the rice isn't done enough, add more boiling-hot stock or water in small additions and continue cooking until the rice reaches the desired doneness. What can I do if the liquid evaporates before the rice is cooked sufficiently? You can add more boiling-hot stock or water in small additions and continue cooking until the rice reaches the desired doneness. What should I do to check if anything is burning at the bottom of the pan?
text: 10. If the liquid cooks off and the rice isn't done enough, add more boiling-hot stock or water in small additions and continue cooking until the rice reaches the desired doneness. You can also use a spoon to carefully dig into the paella and check the bottom of the pan to make sure nothing is burning.

query: What's the first step if I'm using instant or fresh yeast?
text: 1. If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. If using active dry yeast, combine flour with 650g water and combine yeast with 50g warm water; let yeast stand until foamy. Mix flour and water at low speed until they are fully incorporated and form a uniform dough. Alternatively, combine flour and water in a mixing bowl and mix using a dough spatula until dough forms. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let the dough rest for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.

If using active dry yeast, combine flour with 650g water and combine yeast with 50g warm water; let yeast stand until foamy. Mix flour and water at low speed until they are fully incorporated and form a uniform dough. Alternatively, combine flour and water in a mixing bowl and mix using a dough spatula until dough forms. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let the dough rest for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.
gold_answer: If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook.

answer: combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook.

query: What's the first step if I'm using instant or fresh yeast? If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. what else do I mix in with the yeast? flour and all of the water what type of raising agent is best? fresh yeast How should I mix these (salt and yeast) ingredients into the dough? Mix at low speed or by hand until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth. How can I determine if the dough is ready for the next step? Until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth. do I need any seasoning? salt do I mix it by hand? mixer how long do I have to mix everything for? about 3-5 minutes What is the indication that the dough has been adequately mixed? the dough feels elastic and bounces partway back when indented with your thumb What should I do after I transfer the dough to the mixing bowl?
text: 4. Working with oiled hands, gently transfer dough, being careful not to tear its surface, to a lightly oiled mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let dough stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Uncover dough. Working with wet hands and/or a plastic bench scraper, loosen the dough, then gently lift and pull the dough down towards you, folding it in half. Give the bowl a quarter turn and repeat, folding the dough in half towards you. Now give the bowl a half turn and repeat the fold a final time, being careful not to compress it too much. Lastly, pull the unfolded side of your dough carefully up from the bottom, and pull it up and over to form a neat package. Re-cover with plastic wrap and let stand until dough has increased in volume by half, about 1 hour 30 minutes longer.

text: 8. Remove 1 loaf from the refrigerator and gently turn it out, seam-side down, into the preheated Dutch oven. If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. what else do I mix in with the yeast? flour and all of the water what type of raising agent is best? fresh yeast How should I mix these (salt and yeast) ingredients into the dough? Let dough stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. How can I prevent tearing the dough surface when transferring? Working with oiled hands, gently transfer dough. what do I put the dough into? bowl What should I do after transferring the dough to the floured work surface? Using a bench knife, divide dough in half and shape each portion into a ball. Done. What's next? Flip the dough ball over so that the seams you just created are on the bottom and a smooth surface is on top. Let dough rest on the work surface, seam-side down, for 5 minutes. What do I do with the dough balls after they've rested on the work surface? Transfer each dough ball, seam-side up, to a bowl or basket lined with a lightly floured linen cloth or plain, not-fuzzy kitchen towel. what do I do with the doughball next? transfer each dough ball, seam-side up, to a bowl or basket lined with a lightly floured linen cloth or plain, not-fuzzy kitchen towel how long do I leave it to refrigerate? 1 hour What equipment do I need for this step? a Dutch oven At what temperature should the oven be preheated? 500°F (260°C) Should I use the convection setting for this step? do not use it. How should I prepare the surface of the dough before baking? With a razor or paring knife, score the full surface of the dough with 2 parallel lines roughly 3 inches apart. With a spray bottle filled with water, lightly spritz the surface of the dough. what do I spray it with? water how long does it take to cool? 1 hour That's done. What's next? query: How do I handle the mushroom after soaking it?
text: 1. In a small heatproof bowl or measuring cup, soak mushrooms in boiling water until fully softened, about 20 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove mushrooms from soaking liquid and squeeze out excess moisture back into the bowl or measuring cup. Reserve rehydrated mushrooms and 1/4 cup (60ml) soaking liquid, making sure to dispose of any grit that has settled at the bottom.
